title.narrative: ADOLESCENT PARTICIPATION

description.narrative: Adolescents and youth gain greater opportunities to participate in their communities, including through digital networks and media to influence decisions related to their concerns, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children, adolescents and youth are better protected more socially included, prepared for the employment challenges of the future, and engaged in issues of their concern

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Adolescents and youth gain greater opportunities to participate in their communities, including through digital networks and mediato influence decisions related to their concerns

description.narrative: Proactive adolescent engagement in decision making processes was ensured through national consultations/events with adolescents on CAFC platform priorities, mental health, climate change and transitioning to green economy, and child rights. Digital platforms on adolescents’ engagement and online education as well as mental health were developed in a participatory manner to ensure adolescents’ access to necessary online resources at any time. A study ongender roles and stereotypes among adolescent boys and girls as well as access to the online gender-related education for adolescentswere also prioritized. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2022
